boat.name: Indian Runner
boat.short_description:
Indian Runner was built in 2012, was owned from new by Fiona Carter and sailed out of Poole for the first 10 years of her life. She undertook a number of Channel crossings.  In 2022 she was purchased by Roger and Chris Hardman, and is currently based at Port Hamble Marina, in the Solent.  She is entered for the OGA 60 Round Britain cruise.

She has a lifting centreboard so is capable of entering shallow creeks and harbours, plus good lead ballast for stability. She has a distinctive hinged lifting bowsprit, and for the 2023 season is being fitted with a maroon sprayhood.
